intro: Helianthella covillei, commonly known as Coville's sunflower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous fruits and has a compact growth form. Helianthella covillei is often found in open grasslands and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
